meanings.sent1: She was primming herself for the big presentation at work.
meanings.sent2: He always takes his time primming before going out for the evening.
meanings.sent3: The cat was primming itself in front of the mirror, trying to look its best.
meanings.sent4: The chef was primming the ingredients, getting everything ready for the cooking demonstration.
meanings.sent5: The students were primming their notes before the exam, making sure they were well-prepared.

meanings.definition: To apply a primer to (a surface).
meanings.sent1: The painter was primming the walls before starting to paint.
meanings.sent2: She carefully primmed the canvas before beginning her artwork.
meanings.sent3: The car enthusiast was primming his vintage vehicle, making sure the primer was applied evenly.
meanings.sent4: The construction worker was primming the metal beams, ensuring a smooth surface for painting.
meanings.sent5: The DIY enthusiast was primming the furniture, getting it ready for a fresh coat of paint.

meanings.definition: To dress or groom oneself carefully.
meanings.sent1: She was primming in front of the mirror, making sure every hair was in place.
meanings.sent2: He spent hours primming for the special event, choosing the perfect outfit.
meanings.sent3: The dog was primming itself, trying to look its best for the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The model was primming backstage before the fashion show, getting ready for the runway.
meanings.sent5: The actor was primming in the dressing room, preparing for the role of a lifetime.
